node.title: Why some Australian residents have considered abandoning the country during COVID
node.alt: A mother and father holding their child
node.description: Permanent residents and visa holders say border closures andÂ separation from family overseas have impacted their mental health and wellbeing, leaving them questioning whether to remain in Australia.
node.content:
["Kateryna Dmytriyeva was dealing with the pressures of being a new mother and\u00a0managing postpartum depression when the pandemic began.", "Her mother was due to come over from Ukraine to support her, but then Australia's borders closed.", "\"First I was in denial.\u00a0I was just thinking\u00a0it's going to\u00a0be a couple of weeks\u00a0or months \u2026 but then\u00a0it just hit me really hard,\"\u00a0Ms Dmytriyeva said.\u00a0", "\"I was on antidepressants for most of the year and working with psychologists weekly.\"", "Over the course of the pandemic, she applied seven times for a travel\u00a0exemption for her mother.", "Her eighth attempt in October was successful and her mum is now living with her in Sydney.", "\"It has changed my perception of Australia in many ways,\" she said.", "\"I had a strong feeling of rejection towards Australia.", "", "
Kateryna Dmytriyeva did not see\u00a0her mother for nearly two years.(Supplied:\u00a0Kateryna Dmytriyeva)
", "Ms Dmytriyeva was not the only Australian\u00a0resident\u00a0to consider leaving the country permanently because of the federal government's tough border restrictions in response to COVID-19.\u00a0", "Some have told the ABC that\u00a0border closures and\u00a0separation from family overseas have also impacted their mental health and wellbeing.", "Australia's borders were meant to reopen\u00a0to permanent residents and visa holders on December 1, but the plan was delayed by the emergence of the Omicron variant.", "
Border policy 'discriminatory'\u00a0
", "Pradip Sharma, who lives and works in Canberra, said\u00a0he was not able to go\u00a0to his father's funeral in Nepal because he would not have been allowed to re-enter Australia.\u00a0", "Mr Sharma has also been separated from his wife for more than two years.", "He said\u00a0he had\u00a0applied for a travel exemption for his wife 33 times\u00a0and lodged an additional four applications through his migration lawyer.", "None of those applications have been successful.", "He said while the initial decision to shut the country's borders was justified \"to protect people's lives\", the closure had gone on for too long.\u00a0", "", "
Pradip Sharma is working as a pharamacist after studying in Australia for two years.(Supplied: Pradip Sharma)
", "\"My family really wanted me to come back home because my father was sick, even my mother got sick between this time \u2026 but the problem is if I [go to Nepal] I have to leave everything here,\" he said.", "Mr Sharma said he felt the treatment of Australian visa holders in the border exemption process was unfair.", "\"I like Australia, I like the people \u2026\u00a0when they (the federal government)\u00a0announced the border will be open for Singapore citizens \u2026\u00a0that made us feel bad because we've been waiting here for\u00a0two years just to get to see our loved ones.\"", "He said he considered leaving Australia permanently but decided against it\u00a0because he would have had to start his life all over again.", "\"It would be hard for me to leave everything here,\" he said.", "", "
Australia's border closures have\u00a0changed some residents' views of the country.(AAP: Joel Carrett)
", "Prime Minister Scott Morrison previously said the\u00a0temporary pause on easing border restrictions was based on expert medical advice.", "The National Security Committee statement said last month it would\u00a0\"ensure Australia can gather the information we need to better understand the Omicron variant\".", "The ABC has approached the Department of Home Affairs for comment.", "For Ms\u00a0Dmytriyeva, the lengthy process to bring her mother\u00a0to Australia has\u00a0changed her view of the country and even strengthened her resolve to become an Australian citizen.\u00a0", "She had joined\u00a0a Facebook group that petitioned the Australian parliament to consider parents immediate family for the purposes of travel exemptions.", "Ms\u00a0Dmytriyeva was only able to reunite\u00a0with her mother after the rules were changed.", "\"I was fine without being able to vote but this has changed everything and I applied for citizenship \u2026 because I want to vote\u00a0these people out,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"I want more representation, more diversity in the government.\"", "", "
